name: BayesianGroupAna.py
description: This program conducts Bayesian Group Analysis (BGA) on a list of regions of interest (ROIs). Compared to the conventional univariate GLM, BGA pools and shares the information across the ROIs in a multilevel system.
author: AFNI Developers

inputs.name: Data Table
inputs.description: Input text file containing the data table.

inputs.name: Y Variable
inputs.description: Column name for the y variable.

inputs.name: X Variables
inputs.description: Column name(s) for the x variables. If not specified, only the intercept will be added.

inputs.name: No Center
inputs.description: Disable centering on the x variables. Maybe useful if you centered manually.

inputs.name: Iterations
inputs.description: Number of total iterations per chain including warmup. Default [1000]

inputs.name: Control List
inputs.description: Comma separated list of control parameters to pass to the brm function. Default is the brm function defaults.

inputs.name: Plot
inputs.description: Output box, fit, and posterior prediction plots.

inputs.name: More Plots
inputs.description: Output 'stanplots' given different types of plot names.

inputs.name: RData
inputs.description: Save the R session workspace and data.

inputs.name: Seed
inputs.description: Seed to generate random number. Default [1234]

output-files.name: Summary
output-files.description: Summary of the brmsfit object from R.

output-files.name: Rhats
output-files.description: Rhats for each effect and x variable combination.

output-files.name: Intercept Table
output-files.description: Table with the MedianEst, StdDev, 2.50%, 5%, 50%, 95%, and 97.50% of each ROI for the Intercept term.

output-files.name: X Variable Table
output-files.description: The same table as the Intercept but for the specified x variable.
